definition: to expel/to urge on/to drive/to run quickly
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)

sentences.english: This won’t get rid of all the mosquitoes but it will sure help them.
sentences.chinese: 這並不會驅走所有蚊子，但可以有一定效果。

sentences.english: Do not be overcome by evil, but overcome evil with good. —Romans.
sentences.chinese: 光明能驅走黑暗，美善必戰勝罪惡。

sentences.english: The Bible contains one continuous entreaty to cast out fear.
sentences.chinese: 聖經中不斷的祈求人們能驅走恐懼。

sentences.english: Friendship is firewood in cold weather.
Bringing happiness to me and taking the sadness away.
sentences.chinese: 帶來歡聲笑語，驅走悲愁憂傷。

sentences.english: In Norway, it was believed that snow lanterns kept away the trolls.
sentences.chinese: 挪威人認爲雪燈籠可以驅走魔鬼。

sentences.english: Love keeps the cold out better than a cloak.
sentences.chinese: 愛能驅走嚴寒，比大氅更管用。

sentences.english: This is the love that casts out fear.
The steam will condense on the inside of the microwave loosening any stuck on food.
sentences.chinese: 蒸汽將在微波爐內濃縮以驅走食物上的附着物。

sentences.english: Laughter is the sun that drives winter from the human face.
sentences.chinese: 笑聲如陽光，驅走人們臉上的冬天。

sentences.english: I wish I had a little sun to sweep away coldness in the gloomy winter.
sentences.chinese: 給我一個小太陽，在陰霾的冬日，驅走嚴寒。

sentences.english: The speaker laughed away his fears.
